Alhambra, CA 9/26/2010 2 Check-ins Here I lived in Granada Hills for several years, and I lived very close to a Del Taco. I tried it maybe once or twice but I wasn't a fan.
Fast forward several years and I meet my current girlfriend, who has got an unusual crush on Del Taco. So slowly I get into it myself, regretting that I didn't give the Granada Hills location another chance. One thing I've noticed about this chain though, is that their consistency is off, items taste different from location to location, anyways I digress. (I think I may have ADHD, you may have noticed by reading some other reviews of mine.)
My friend Eric knows that I like Del Taco and would always tell me that I NEED to try this particular Del Taco. So on our way back from Vegas, my gf and I thought, why not! As we parked and walked in, nothing looked extremely different, except for that every table has it's own sauce caddy. YES!!! We were very hungry but for some reason we just simply decided on having one burrito each (we can put some Del Taco away!). We went with the spicy chicken burrito (add sour cream). When we got our burritos (they bring them to your table btw!), first thing we noticed is; DAMN these are big burritos! Much MUCH bigger than any burrito I've ever gotten from any other Del Taco. The presentation was nice too, it was wrapped around the packaging, but rather just sitting on it.
On to the taste, it was (compared to other Del Tacos) AMAZING! I mean it was ridiculously better! How can this place call itself Del Taco, when it's leaps-and-bounds better than the others? It's a discredit to itself! I loved the burrito, and I'm not a huge fan of burritos in general. I just think most burritos are mostly tortilla, not this one though.
The service was really good too, the people working there genuinely looked and acted friendly. The girl behind the counter was happy to tell us that this was the first Del Taco. I think I read somewhere that the original Del Taco owner actually owns this one, I wouldn't be surprised. He obviously takes pride in his restaurant.
If you're at all a fan of Del Taco (hell, even if you're not!), stop in! You won't regret it!

The second ever location, and they have the actual Classic taco from the old school menu. It's a huge meaty monstrosity stuffed with fresh grated cheddar and lettuce and topped with a fat blushing slice of steak tomato. I swear the ground beef is different - they must cook it fresh to order. While I don't usually apply 'Bigger is Better' to most things in life, it is definitely true in the case of this menu.
Curse you, original Del Taco. At the other locations I could order a 99cent red burrito and a classic taco and eat both with gusto. Now there is only room for one or the other. A dilemma which usually ends in ordering both and regretfully bringing one home, only to later be eaten by the fiancé on the sly. DRAT!

Whittier, CA 12/9/2007 When I was a kid, fast food wasn't a weekly dinner option...it was more like a monthly treat. After maybe a long day of yardwork, my dad would announce that we were gonna have Del Taco...man did it make us happy! My mom would take our order and drive down and get it for to-go. Us kids couldn't wait for her to get back!
Fast-forward a few years: Most Del Taco's have the Taco Tuesday with 3 anorexic, tomato-less little dudes for a buck, no flagship Bun Taco or Tostada. No more brown and orange sun logo or orange taco wrapper. Not to mention that people eat fast-food so much that it seems to have become a FOOD GROUP!
The Del Taco in Barstow/Lenwood is a jewel in the desert...the last of its kind. They have the old-school food that I remember. Tacos are big, complete with the slice of tomato and orange wrapper...they have tostadas served on a little cardboard tray. Of course, the crinkle cut fries. They even still have the bun taco and combo-cup, for chrissakes! Anytime I go to Vegas, I stop here on the way in and the way out. The food really brings back the old memories...makes me wanna break out my OP corduroy shorts and rip wallet.
Let's bring back fast-food as a treat and not a God-given, cheap, and all-too-easy right. Then maybe all Del Taco's will step up and serve this kind of fare...then again, maybe not...I'd probably eat it too much.

Long Beach, CA 12/16/2010 1 Check-in Here OK, so I heard this is supposed to be the real deal. Where the original creator of Del taco still works and prides himself in these amazing tacos. So I dont know why, but I was expecting something special, something homemade. I'm pretty stupid for thinking that and creating unrealistic expectations from a fast food joint. here's how my experience went.
The outside looks normal, but when you go inside you notice a difference. Huge dining area, clean and.... TACO SAUCE, AT THE TABLES! Crazy! They were carefully packed and neatly organized as well. It's nice to walk into a fast food joint where you know the owners... care. Pretty reminiscent of another fast food joint we all loved called In N Out.
So we got in and the menu was pretty standard as far as I could tell. I ordered a macho burrito and macho fries. I felt macho that day, what can I say? I was ready for Vegas.
ANYWAY, the food came and initially I was pretty disappointed. But upon careful inspection, I did notice a few things. Burrito was better wrapped and there was just more meat as opposed to beans and lettuce at other Del Taco joints.
All in all, this was better than any Del Taco I've been to before. However, don't forget that it's still a fast food joint at the end of the day.

Pomona, CA 10/8/2007 Cool, I'm no. 10 to review this place. Woohoo!!
So, nothing else can be said about eating at Del Taco in Barstow or for that matter at any other Del Taco in the whole of the Del Taco universe. But here is my two cents.
Tacos here are slightly larger than other Del Taco's I've been to. I think they actually stuff them more here. The great thing about this place, is that the menu appears to have more choices than others I've been to before. The service is exceptionally fast and what more could you ask for to have your Del Scorcho, mild sauce, and ketchup sitting at your table waiting for you. I mean before I was barely sitting for one minute, the food was already on the way over to our table. How cool is that?! The seating in this place is plentiful. This place was hopping, but we were able to find a place to sit with no problem.
The only thing I have to say against this place is that they should move the forks and other utensils near the straws by the soda fountain. Otherwise, you're going from one side of restaurant to the other and having to navigate your way through the ordering line (that's no fun).
Other than that, this is a quick and easy place to come to while you're on the road to whatever your destination happens to be.
